description.narrative: Support to increased production of and access to renewable energy systems in East and West Sepik Provinces of Papua New Guinea

participating-org.narrative: FOOD AND AGRICULTURE ORGANIZATION OF THE UNITED NATIONS

activity-description.narrative: East Sepik Province is a target province.
West Sepik Povince is also a target province.

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

provider-org.narrative: FOOD AND AGRICULTURE ORGANIZATION OF THE UNITED NATIONS
FOOD AND AGRICULTURE ORGANIZATION OF THE UNITED NATIONS

FOOD AND AGRICULTURE ORGANIZATION OF THE UNITED NATIONS

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: 1. National policy developed with associated regulations for renewable energy. 2. Policy notes developed for senior decision makers to help with facilitating the installation of renewable energy-based electricity generation systems. 3. Number of provincial and national energy working group meetings organized and reports shared. 4. Number (proportion) of MSMEs in the project area having access to project-supported renewable energy systems (except biomass). 5. Renewable energy generation facilities (except biomass) in operation in the project area established with project support. 6. Proportion of MSMEs in the project area having access to project-supported renewable energy systems (except biomass). 7. Annual amount of electricity (in KW) generated from renewable energy sources established with project support in the project area. 8. Database and website developed and in operation. 9. Number of awareness raising initiatives on renewable energy. 10. Report of gaps in current licensing arrangements identified for improvement. 11. Improved energy legislation and regulations submitted to government of PNG.

comment.narrative: 1. National Energy Policy 2017-2020 requires specific policies in relation to renewable energy. No sub-national policies. 2. No clear licensing requirement for renewable energy systems. 3. No accreditation standards for renewable energy systems in Papua New Guinea. 4. Most public facilities either have no electricity generation or some generation using fossil fuels. 5. No appropriate market assessment available. 6. None to limited capacity in generating renewable energy in the designated project area. 7. None to limited access to renewable energy and energy efficiency systems in designated project areas.

Sub-output 1: Support provided at policy and strategy levels to the Government of PNG on inclusion of food and agriculture in renewable energy development. Target: - 2 x Policy Notes Developed for Senior Decision Makers to help with facilitating the installation of renewable energy- based electricity generation systems.. - 4 x Provincial and National Energy Sector Working Group meetings organized and reports shared. - 1 x website and database developed and in use. - 2 x Awareness raising initiative developed and implemented. One in East Sepik and one in West Sepik. - 1 x Report of gaps in current licensing arrangements identified for improvement. - 1 x Improved energy legislation and regulations submitted to the GoPNG. - 1 x Model accreditation standard prepared and shared for use. - 1 x Accreditation and certification system advisory notes developed and shared with government of Papua New Guinea. - 2 x Accreditation and certification system capacity building workshops organized.
Sub-output 2: Feasibility of/investment options for renewable energy generation systems assessed. Targets: - 5 x Feasibility study reports for solar power generation sites in East and West Sepik Provinces. - 1 x Market assessment report outlines potential suppliers of equipment both at the domestic and international stage. - 5 x Impact assessment (report) of potential pilot sites and public institutions. - 3 x Report on alternative funding sources and brokering support opportunities explored for investment. - 3 x Advisory notes on investment options for project support and partnerships including EU-Blended financing Prepared and used for project support and partnership negotiations. - 1 x symposium/trade expo fares on renewable energy technology solutions convened. - 2 x Outcome report(s) on possible financing models approached to support renewable energy demonstrations.
Sub-output 3: Solar power based renewable energy generating systems established in public facilities in West and East Sepiks Target(s): - 5 x Feasibility study reports for energy efficiency audits of selected sites. - 5 x Environmental impact and social assessment reports of selected sites. - 6 x Solar-power generating electricity facilities installed at selected public facilities. - 5 x Report of assessment of suitable options, sites, technical specifications and hosts for the installation of solar power generating facilities. - 20 x Report of public consultations held includes requirements and end-users expectations for solar-based power sources. - 2 x Report identifying baselines against which to measure user, peak-periods and energy efficiency. - 1 x Data modelling report to inform policy and regulation discussions. - 3 x Commissioning reports for relevant installed equipment and O&M plans. - 10 x Beneficiaries trained on maintenance, operations ad budgeting renewable energy installations, disaggregated by sex and age.

Sub-output 1: - 1 X policy note developed for solar sub-policy. The policy was developed and is undergoing review by the National Energy Authority - No provincial and national energy working group meeting organized due to the Covid 19 Pandemic BCP. However, discussions with government partners to convene the meetings in 2022 were initiated. - No website and database was developed. This activity will be undertaken in 2022. - No awareness raising initiatives were developed and implemented due to Covid 19 Pandemic restrictions. However, one on one consultations were held with relevant stakeholder to promote RE in both East and West Sepik Provinces. - No advisory note being prepared and shared with government of PNG partners, however, discussions were initiated with the relevant government agency. - This activity was not undertaken as the capacity building workshop will be determine by the above activity on accreditation and certification of Solar Photovoltaic systems.
Sub - output 2; - On track. Feasibility studies was conducted for a total of 7 sites in both the East and West Sepik Province. - A market analysis was conducted and the report yet to be shared. - A total of 7 impact assessment reports were conducted for the selected pilot sites in both East and West Sepik Provinces. - An draft assessment report for alternate funding sources and brokering support opportunities for investment is being developed and will be shared for review. - This activity will built on from the assessment report above. No advisory note was developed. - No symposium / trade fairs held due to Covid 19 pandemic restrictions. Activity moved to 2022. - No outcome report produced.
Sub-output 3: - 7 x feasibility studies reports for energy efficiency reports done for selected sites. - No environmental impact and social assessment report was done for the selected sites due to Covid 19 Pandemic restrictions. - No solar power generation electricity facilities were installed at the selected sites. However, systems designs were done for 7 sites and the contract awarded to a contractor to install the Solar generating facilities. - 7 x assessment reports of suitable options, sites, technical specifications and hosts for the installation of power power generation facilities. - No public consultations were conducted. However, 16 one on one consultative meetings were held with relevant provincial government stakeholders and beneficiaries. - 7 reports identifying baseline of which to measure user peak periods and energy efficiency were produced. - No reports were produced for data modelling to inform policy and regulations. - No commissioning reports were done for relevant equipment and O&M plans. This activity will be conducted after the installations of the solar panels. - No beneficiaries were trained on maintenance, operation and budgeting renewable energy installations, However, 8 PNG Power technical officers were trained on solar PV rooftop installations.

Sub-output 1: Support provided at policy and strategy levels to the Government of PNG on inclusion of food and agriculture in renewable energy development. Target: - 2 x Policy Notes Developed for Senior Decision Makers to help with facilitating the installation of renewable energy- based electricity generation systems.. - 2 x Provincial and National Energy Sector Working Group meetings organized and reports shared. - 1 x website and database developed and in use. - 1 x Awareness raising initiative developed and implemented. - 1 x Report of gaps in current licensing arrangements identified for improvement. - 1 x Improved energy legislation and regulations submitted to the GoPNG.
Sub-output 2: Feasibility of/investment options for renewable energy generation systems assessed. Targets: - 1 x Feasibility study report for solar power generation sites in East and West Sepik Provinces. - 1 x Market assessment report outlines potential suppliers of equipment both at the domestic and international stage. - 1 x Impact assessment (report) of potential pilot sites and public institutions. - 1 x Report on alternative funding sources and brokering support opportunities explored for investment.
Sub-output 3: Solar power based renewable energy generating systems established in public facilities in West and East Sepiks Target(s): - 1 x Feasibility study reports for energy efficiency audits of selected sites. - 1 x Environmental impact and social assessment reports of selected sites. - 3 x Solar-power generating electricity facilities installed at selected public facilities. - 1 x Report of assessment of suitable options, sites, technical specifications and hosts for the installation of solar power generating facilities. - 1 x Report of public consultations held includes requirements and end-users expectations for solar-based power sources. - 1 x Report identifying baselines against which to measure user, peak-periods and energy efficiency. - 1 x Data modelling report to inform policy and regulation discussions.

Sub-output 1: - No policy notes developed for senior decision makers. However, an inception report has been completed for Solar Energy and associated regulations. - No provincial and national energy working group meeting organized due to Covid-19 pandemic restrictions. - No website and database developed for implementation yet due to a lack of PMU support caused by difficulty with recruitment of suitable candidates to be based in Wewak, East Sepik province. - No awareness raising initiative developed for implementation due to a lack of PMU support caused by difficulty with recruitment of suitable candidates to be based in Wewak, East Sepik province. - Commenced gap analysis on current licensing arrangements, yet to complete a report. - Yet to submit to government an improved energy legislation and regulations. This is pending the gap analysis and further stakeholder consultations.
Sub-output 2: - Commenced work on conducting feasibility studies. An inception report was completed. - Commenced work on market assessment for potential suppliers of equipment both at the domestic and international stage. - An impact assessment of the same sites identified by the feasibility studies above is pending finalization of site selection. - Commenced work on identifying alternative funding sources to assist with installation of the systems identified by the feasibility studies.
Sub-output 3: - Feasibility studies have commenced. This is the same work in sub-output 2 above. - Environmental impact and social assessment work has started. This is the same work in sub-output 2 above. - No solar-power generation systems installed yet. This is pending the completion of feasibility and environmental and social impact studies. - Public consultations could not start in 2020 due to restrictions caused by the Covid-19 pandemic and a lack of PMU support. - Work on identifying the baselines for energy use is delayed to start in 2021 due to a lack of PMU support. - Work has commenced on data modelling to inform policy and regulation. See inception report referred to sub-output 1 above.
